title: Poison (film)
text:
Poison is a 1991 American <a href="Science%20fiction%20film">science fiction</a> <a href="Drama%20film">drama</a> <a href="horror%20film">horror film</a> written and directed by <a href="Todd%20Haynes">Todd Haynes</a> and starring Edith Meeks, Larry Maxwell, Susan Gayle Norman, Scott Renderer, and <a href="James%20Lyons%20%28film%20editor%29">James Lyons</a>.
It is composed of three intercut stories that are partially inspired by the novels of <a href="Jean%20Genet">Jean Genet</a>. With its <a href="gay">gay</a> themes, "Poison" is considered an early entry in the <a href="New%20Queer%20Cinema">New Queer Cinema</a> movement. The film had its world premiere at the <a href="Sundance%20Film%20Festival">Sundance Film Festival</a> on January 11, 1991. It was released in a <a href="limited%20release">limited release</a> by <a href="Zeitgeist%20Films">Zeitgeist Films</a> on April 5, 1991.

Release.

Reception.
The film received generally positive reviews. It currently holds a 77% "fresh" rating on <a href="Rotten%20Tomatoes">Rotten Tomatoes</a> based on 22 reviews, with a <a href="weighted%20arithmetic%20mean">weighted average</a> of 6.84/10. The site's consensus reads, "<a href="Claustrophobic">Claustrophobic</a> and quirky horror, this is a decently dirty debut for director <a href="Todd%20Haynes">Todd Haynes</a>".
